input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: CITY OF LIESTAL, CIVIL ENGINEERING SECTOR. Summary: External Administrative Department for Wastewater (Control Body for Wastewater Connection Requests). Description: The city of Liestal is tendering a service for an external wastewater department (supervisory body, property drainage specialist / client support). The specialist office processes wastewater connection requests and carries out inspections Acceptance of private property drainage systems. Per On average, 40 to 60 applications are examined each year. The time required for this is recorded in Chapter 7 (Offer). The actual amount of work depends on the economy and can vary. A linear/constant workload cannot therefore be guaranteed when placing an order for the service. The resulting service contract will be concluded from January 1, 2027 for a term of 5 years. The Notice period is 6 months before the end of the year. The notice of termination must be delivered by registered mail. The services include the technical preliminary review, application review, on-site execution controls, final inspections as well as the review of the audit documents TV logs. The services are provided in accordance with the applicable regulations, the GEP of the city of Liestal and the cantonal/federal regulations. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: SCHLUEIN COMMUNITY. Summary: Development of Val Da Schluein: Subproject Tp3 Torrent Barriers, Engineering Work. Description: The torrent in the Val da Schluein (Schlueinertobel) is built with a number of barriers and channeled in the upper cone area. Several dams in the catchment area were severely damaged in an event in 2004. The condition of the locks has changed has now massively deteriorated and is worrying. The urgency of the project is classified as high because several residential buildings are in the red danger zone. The damaged torrent barriers in the catchment area should be repaired so that not too much bedload material is mobilized in the event of a flood. However, renovation of the barriers in the steep, difficult-to-access catchment area of ​​the Val da Tschessas should be avoided because this would involve a disproportionately large amount of damage would require effort. Engineering work (submission project (procurement) / execution project / local construction management / commissioning / COMPLETION) of the SIA phases 41, 51, 52 and 53 must be offered and processed for the project. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: RHAETIAN RAILWAY AG. Summary: Davos Laret Pilot Road Renewal 2026. Description: On the Cavadürli - Davos Laret section between km 39.281 - 40.631, a pilot road renewal is planned. A total renovation of this section of the route is planned. The track section is larger, especially in summer Track position instabilities occur. The gravel is heavily contaminated with fine particles. Due to the expansion of services, this route is heavily used, so the load on the track does not decrease. In order not to worsen the current situation, the Section to be rebuilt as soon as possible. The synergies and route closures of the station project should be used to avoid opening a construction site again at a later date (approx. in 5-10 years). At the same time this represents Track section represents an optimal test field to verify the results of the RAILplus vehicle/track interaction research project. A complete new track construction with subsurface renewal including sectional construction is planned Installation of a PSS and an AC Rail covering, including the associated drainage system. At the same time, all cable systems will be renewed and expanded. The superstructure will then be completely renewed. During the superstructure renovation, the system and Research findings from the above-mentioned research project implemented. Description: As part of the PAC STEP Aïre project, the hydraulic package consists of the manufacture, supply and assembly of pipes and hydraulic equipment for the PAC plant (PAC building + STAP + connections between buildings), as well as the services annexes, described in these specifications. This call for tender concerns the entire hydraulic part of the process including several types of equipment with different pressures and nominal diameters. Please note that this call for tender only concerns the hydraulic equipment for two heat pump lines and the “pre-equipment” for the 3rd heat pump line which will be installed subsequently (outside the scope of this AO, see chapter 3.3). input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: MUNICIPALITY OF SCHLUEIN. Summary: Development of Val Da Schluein: Subproject Tp3 Torrent Barriers, Engineering Work. Description: The torrent in the Val da Schluein (Schlueinertobel) is built with a number of barriers and channeled in the upper cone area. Several dams in the catchment area were severely damaged in an event in 2004. The condition of the locks has changed has now massively deteriorated and is worrying. The urgency of the project is classified as high because several residential buildings are in the red danger zone. Main CPV: 71000000 architectural, construction and services Engineering offices and testing centers. Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-01-26. Competition: ICB. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: MUNICIPALITY OF SAAS-GRUND (BIKE PLAN AG). Summary: Hohsaas-Kreuzboden Mountain Bike Trail. Description: Realization of a mountain bike trail that is to be largely newly built and leads in sections over existing paths that have to be adapted to the bike. The route leads from the Hohsaas mountain station via the Weissmies hut to the Kreuzboden.The aim is to create an attractive and needs-based offer that is safe, guides and channels bikers and enables optimal riding fun using the most modern trail design. The type of infrastructure is alpine, built close to nature Mountain bike path/trail of moderate difficulty (red). Only the trail itself is intended as a structure. Total length: 7,785m, of which new building: 5,375m, depth meter: 705m, ⌀ gradient: 10%, ⌀ trail width: 1m (in curves up to 1.5m).Additional fall Replacement measures (dismantling of the old ski slope route). All further information can be found in the enclosed documents (technical report and the plan supplements). Place of contract fulfillment 3910, VS, Switzerland Main CPV: 45233162 Construction of cycle paths. Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-01-23. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: FEDERAL OFFICE FOR ROADS ASTRA - DEPARTMENT OF ROAD INFRASTRUCTURE-EAST - F3 ZOFINGEN. Summary: N02, Second Gotthard Tube (2Tg Röhre Nord) and N02 Rehabilitation of First Gotthard Tube (1Tg Röhre Süd) Bsa-Los 8304 - Hlk-Anlagen. Description: In order to enable the renovation of the existing - around 17 km long - Gotthard road tunnel, the Federal Council, Parliament and the population have decided to build a second tube. The BSA equipment of the second tube, referred to as tube north, will take place between 2027 and 2030, partly parallel to the completion of the structural work. Parallel to the north tube, the Galleria di Airolo (GdA) with a length of around 1 km is also being built, which is an integral part of the Gotthard system forms. Main CPV: 45331000 Installation of heating, ventilation and air conditioning systems. Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-02-13. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: CANTONAL CIVIL ENGINEERING OFFICE (OCGC) - ENGINEERING WORKS SERVICE. Summary: Voie-Des-Traz and P47/49 Multimodal Hub - Construction of a Platform and Implementation of Road Developments - Horizon 2025 - Construction Market. Description: The cantonal civil engineering office (OCGC), of the department of health and mobility (DSM) plans, between 2026 and 2028 and in coordination with sector projects, the implementation of road developments, as well as a multimodal platform in the sector from Genève Aéroport, at zones P47 and P49. The project co-financed by the confederation, is part of the 3rd generation of the agglomeration project (PA3), under measures 32-1-20 and 32-2-13, and aims to improve efficiency of public transport service, strengthen connections between buses, trams and P+R and improve access to soft modes of transport. Measure 32-2-13 includes: - The new Voie-des-Traz (VDT). The current Voie-des-Traz must be demolished in the framework of the work on the future logistics center of Genève Aéroport. The new Voie-des-Traz is shifted to the South, thus allowing a connection with the PS Pavillon ramp; - A track for active mobility along the Contra-sens Batailleux; - A sidewalk along the Voie-des-Traz; - Retaining walls; - Deep foundations. Measure 32-1-20 includes: - A multimodal reinforced concrete platform. The platform will enable the pedestrian connection between the future P+R and the future TNGS, in the short and medium term. term. In the long term (by 2032), the platform will be accessible to the bus, thus allowing a direct connection between the Cap2030 multimodal interface, the future TNGS tram and the future P+R; - Foundations.... Published Date: 2025-12-22. Closing Date: 2026-02-27. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Description: REAL operates a sludge incineration plant (SVA), whose flue gas cleaning consists, among other things, of a wet scrubber with an acid and a basic scrubber column. Both columns show significant signs of age and are completely closed substitute. The subject of this submission project is the replacement of the acidic and basic scrubber columns. The entrepreneurial service includes detailed engineering, participation in meetings, design, manufacturing, delivery, assembly, Commissioning and complete documentation of the two new scrubber columns. The acid scrubber must be manufactured and delivered no later than three weeks before the planned assembly date in November 2026. The detailed engineering of the The acid and basic scrubber columns must be carried out in parallel and must be completed by the start of production of the acid scrubber at the latest. The alkaline scrubber must be manufactured and delivered no later than three weeks before the scheduled date Assembly date to take place in November 2027. Summary: Works by the Construction and Railway Technical Contractor of Prossif Lot 13: Infrastructural Interventions for the Semi-Hourly Cadence.. Description: The PROSSIF Lot 13 contract is a renewal lot of the Tegna and Intragna stops. This contract includes civil engineering services - railway technology such as track renewal - safety systems - contact line - low voltage systems, which has as its objective the introduction of the semi-hourly cadence for regional trains between Intragna and Muralto as envisaged by the project to strengthen the FART offer, the operation of which has been approved by the Swiss parliament through the fund PROSSIF 2035 with the aim of improving the attractiveness of regional public transport. Furthermore, the adaptations will comply with the legislation on disabled people LDis, RS 151.3 which came into force on 1 January 2004. With the replacement of the rolling stock existing, FART is developing a strategy capable of guaranteeing access to the station and trains to all users, including people with motor disabilities. The main quantities are reported in the procurement document "B1 - Provisions details" The complete technical data are an integral part of the specifications. Description: Subject of the Contract: As part of the project, the existing gymnasium will be extended by adding two additional floors for use as a secondary school. The extension will be constructed using timber element construction. The new/extended staircases will be built as double-shell structures in exposed concrete. The two-story extension will include 12 classrooms (one of which will be equipped as a learning space), 7 group rooms, and two staff rooms with a terrace. At the heart of the school, a single-story atrium (open to the outside climate) is designed. Special Conditions: The renovation will take place predominantly during ongoing operations. A complete closure of the gymnasium is only planned for the duration of the timber construction work for the extension Structural Works: Partial Demolition and Dismantling of Existing Installations. Site Facilities Including Construction Fence, Reinforced Concrete Works Mainly Fair-Faced Concrete, Foundation Reinforcements, Waterproofing, Drilling and Cutting of Concrete. <br> Doc Title: BKP 211 Structural Works | Extension of Sports Hall TBS5, Weinfelden <br> Contract Type: works. Published Date: 2025-12-19. Closing Date: 2026-01-27. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: SID - CITY POLICE (STAPO). Summary: Key and Security Service. Description: The purpose of this tender is to evaluate a contractor that the Zurich City Police Operations Center can deploy if necessary to gain access to buildings, apartments or rooms in the Zurich area. The tasks include Emergency door openings, replacement and repair of locks - emergency locks/replacement doors - and other services in the area of ​​locking technology. The emergency opening can cause broken glass and further damage to door and door frames. For this reason A wide range of materials and specialist knowledge is necessary to complete the order correctly. The accessibility and availability of the service provider must be guaranteed at all times (365 days/24 hours). Main CPV: 70000000 Real Estate Services. Published Date: 2025-12-19. Closing Date: 2026-02-20. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: CONSTRUCTION AND TRANSPORT DEPARTMENT OF THE CANTON OF BASEL-STADT, CANTONAL DEPARTMENT FOR PUBLIC PROCUREMENT (KFÖB). Summary: Renovation of the Bäumlihof Basel Gym and Swimming Pool - Bkp 231.5 Pv System. Description: Renovation of the Bäumlihof gymnasium and swimming pool, Basel: The high school was planned from 1972 to 1974 by Vischer Architekten AG, Basel. The facility, designed in the functional style of the 1970s, comprises a total of seven wings, including two swimming pools and six gymnasiums. The four school wings were completely renovated between September 2014 and August 2018. Section T (gym and swimming pool) was put on hold and will be completed in the coming years. The project perimeter of the renovation is limited to the building itself. A change of use is not planned. The conversion will take place in two stages, with the first stage being converted while the second stage is still in operation. After a moving phase and commissioning of the first stage, the second stage will be renovated. With According to the current advertisement, we are looking for a contractor who will dismantle the existing PV system and install a new PV system on the flat roofs. Main CPV: 45212000 Construction work for buildings used for leisure, sport, culture, etc Accommodation and meals are provided. Published Date: 2025-12-19. Closing Date: 2026-02-03. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: CONSTRUCTION AND TRANSPORT DEPARTMENT OF THE CANTON OF BASEL-STADT, CANTONAL DEPARTMENT FOR PUBLIC PROCUREMENT (KFÖB)
output.Summary: Renovation of the Bäumlihof Basel Gym and Swimming Pool - Bkp 231.5 Pv System
output.Description: Renovation of the Bäumlihof gymnasium and swimming pool, Basel: The high school was planned from 1972 to 1974 by Vischer Architekten AG, Basel. The facility, designed in the functional style of the 1970s, comprises a total of seven wings, including two swimming pools and six gymnasiums. The four school wings were completely renovated between September 2014 and August 2018. Section T (gym and swimming pool) was put on hold and will be completed in the coming years. The project perimeter of the renovation is limited to the building itself. A change of use is not planned. The conversion will take place in two stages, with the first stage being converted while the second stage is still in operation. After a moving phase and commissioning of the first stage, the second stage will be renovated. With According to the current advertisement, we are looking for a contractor who will dismantle the existing PV system and install a new PV system on the flat roofs. Main CPV: 45212000 Construction work for buildings used for leisure, sport, culture, etc Accommodation and meals are provided

instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: TICINESE REGIONAL RAILWAY BUS COMPANY FART (SA). Summary: Prossif Construction Company and Railway Engineering Works Lot 13: Infrastructure Interventions for Half-Hourly Operations.. Description: The PROSSIF Lot 13 contract is a renewal lot of the Tegna and Intragna stops. This contract includes civil engineering services - railway technology such as track renewal - safety systems - contact line - low voltage systems, which has as its objective the introduction of the semi-hourly cadence for regional trains between Intragna and Muralto as envisaged by the project to strengthen the FART offer, the operation of which has been approved by the Swiss parliament through the fund PROSSIF 2035 with the aim of improving the attractiveness of regional public transport. Furthermore, the adaptations will comply with the legislation on disabled people LDis, RS 151.3 which came into force on 1 January 2004. With the replacement of the rolling stock existing, FART is developing a strategy capable of guaranteeing access to the station and trains to all users, including people with motor disabilities. Main CPV: 45000000 Construction works. Published Date: 2025-12-18. Closing Date: 2026-02-05. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: TICINESE REGIONAL RAILWAY BUS COMPANY FART (SA)
output.Summary: Prossif Construction Company and Railway Engineering Works Lot 13: Infrastructure Interventions for Half-Hourly Operations.
output.Description: The PROSSIF Lot 13 contract is a renewal lot of the Tegna and Intragna stops. This contract includes civil engineering services - railway technology such as track renewal - safety systems - contact line - low voltage systems, which has as its objective the introduction of the semi-hourly cadence for regional trains between Intragna and Muralto as envisaged by the project to strengthen the FART offer, the operation of which has been approved by the Swiss parliament through the fund PROSSIF 2035 with the aim of improving the attractiveness of regional public transport. Furthermore, the adaptations will comply with the legislation on disabled people LDis, RS 151.3 which came into force on 1 January 2004. With the replacement of the rolling stock existing, FART is developing a strategy capable of guaranteeing access to the station and trains to all users, including people with motor disabilities. Main CPV: 45000000 Construction works

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: AXPO GRID AG. Summary: L220 110 Kv Line Freienbach - Siebnen, Cable Pipe Block. Description: 1.1 Introduction AXPO Grid AG operates a supra-regional distribution network in the “Zürichsee Süd” area. By converting the existing Freienbach - Siebnen overhead line (L220) from 50 kV to 110 kV, the conditions will be created in the “Zurichsee Süd” region. to change the voltage. This serves to ensure long-term security of supply of electrical energy throughout northeastern Switzerland. The existing overhead line between the Freienbach and Siebnen substations from the Waldegg in Freienbach and the Wiler Äbnet in Altendorf were buried. Axpo intends to wire the existing 16 or 50 kV overhead line between the M57 to M83 masts with a single strand and between the M83 mast and the M115 mast with two strands. The approximately 8.2 km long The majority of the pipeline section is to be laid underground in open trenches, supplemented by ramming and flushing drilling. All planned measures (cable pipe routes, crossings under bodies of water and modes of transport) are in the planning documents included for submission. The dismantling of the existing overhead line is not the subject of this submission. The work is accompanied by environmental construction supervision (UBB) and soil science construction supervision (BBB). The relevant requirements are taken into account in the submission documents and can be found in detail in the corresponding environmental note for the project. 1.2 Initial situation / project description The advertised services include the following main.... A central focus is on seamlessness Integration of the new image data management into the existing PACS to ensure the structured, secure and standardized archiving of all image and video data generated in the OR. The new operating lights and ceiling supply units should also be installed enable ergonomic, hygienic and workflow-oriented improvements and be technically coordinated. The hospital attaches particular importance to robust, economically viable and long-term operable solutions that provide a reliable Ensure operation, low lifecycle costs and sustainable expandability. The aim is to create a future-proof, digitally networked and operationally stable operating environment. The tender is carried out in three separate lots in order to make it clear To enable structuring of the procurement process and to meet the specific technical requirements of the individual components. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: CITY OF ILLNAU-EFFRETIKON, BUILDING CONSTRUCTION DEPARTMENT. Summary: New Fire Department and Factory Building, Bkp225.2 Special Insulation. Description: The existing fire department building, the work yard integrated into it (maintenance and forestry operations) and the main collection point, water supply and various civil defense systems in Illnau-Effretikon located elsewhere do not meet today's needs more. These various municipal businesses and their required rooms should therefore be brought together on the property in the Eselriet area on the outskirts of Effretikon, which is centrally located for the entire municipal area. The new location in Eselriet offers the opportunity to fully implement the needs raised by the security and civil engineering departments. Therefore, a new fire department and factory building for the security departments (fire department, rescue service, civil defense) and Civil engineering (maintenance operations, forestry operations and nature conservation, disposal, water supply) arise. The aim is to realize a sustainable, future-oriented and practical system that creates synergies and meets the needs of the fire department, Civil defense, maintenance operations, forestry operations, main collection point and water supply combined. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: PAUL SCHERRER INSTITUT (PSI). Summary: Dismantling of Alpha Laboratories. Description: Within the scope of this tender, it is planned to dismantle the infrastructure of two alpha laboratories of the PSI hot laboratory (Hotlab), which was used for fuel research programs between 1979 and 2005 and is in a controlled area. The infrastructure mainly includes glove boxes and equipment for the treatment, preparation, and analysis of fuels. By dismantling these, the plant operator fulfils the obligations of the KEG and the KEV. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: CITY OF ILLNAU-EFFRETIKON, DEPARTMENT OF BUILDING CONSTRUCTION (HOCHBAU). Summary: New Construction of the Fire and Municipal Services Building - Bkp 225.2 Special Insulation. Description: The existing fire department building, the work yard integrated into it (maintenance and forestry operations) and the main collection point, water supply and various civil defense systems in Illnau-Effretikon located elsewhere do not meet today's needs more. These various municipal businesses and their required rooms should therefore be brought together on the property in the Eselriet area on the outskirts of Effretikon, which is centrally located for the entire municipal area. The new location in Eselriet offers the opportunity to fully implement the needs raised by the security and civil engineering departments. Therefore, a new fire department and factory building for the security departments (fire department, rescue service, civil defense) and Civil engineering (maintenance operations, forestry operations and nature conservation, disposal, water supply) arise. The aim is to realize a sustainable, future-oriented and practical system that creates synergies and meets the needs of the fire department, Civil defense, maintenance operations, forestry operations, main collection point and water supply combined. Main CPV: 45210000 construction work in building construction. Published Date: 2025-12-17. Closing Date: 2026-01-30. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Summary: Renovation of the Bäumlihof Basel Gym and Swimming Hall - Bkp 283.1 - Metal Ceilings (Re-Use). Description: Renovation of the Bäumlihof gymnasium and swimming pool, Basel: The high school was planned from 1972 to 1974 by Vischer Architekten AG, Basel. The facility, designed in the functional style of the 1970s, comprises a total of seven wings, including two swimming pools and six gymnasiums. The four school wings were completely renovated between September 2014 and August 2018. Section T (gym and swimming pool) was put on hold and will be completed in the coming years. The project perimeter of the renovation is limited to the building itself. A change of use is not planned. The conversion will take place in two stages, with the first stage being converted while the second stage is still in operation. After a moving phase and commissioning of the first stage, the second stage will be renovated. The Existing metal ceilings in the cloakrooms will be dismantled, refreshed, adjusted and expanded. We are looking for a suitable contractor for this work. Main CPV: 45212000 Construction work for buildings used for leisure, sport, culture, etc Accommodation and meals are provided. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: COMMUNITY D-LON. Summary: Repair of Asphalt and Rails in Villars-Sur-Ollon - Construction Market. Description: The municipality of Ollon wishes to repair the surface of the cantonal road linking Arveyes and Villars-sur-Ollon, a length of approximately 1.20km. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: TRIDEL SA. Summary: Submission of Rail Transport Services for Incinerable Waste and Residues. Description: This is a service contract which includes all transfers to the contracting party's station for its waste supply and from this same station for the evacuation of bottom ash and ashes. The market is divided into two lots: · description of the services of lot 1: transport, in closed skips belonging to the contracting authority, or sometimes in open skips, of waste coming from the entire supply area of ​​the contracting authority (maximum 8 transshipment points rail/road), or even inter-plant transfers (shipment of waste to other recovery plants during TRIDEL shutdown periods); · description of the services of lot 2: transport in open skips of bottom ash and washed ashes from the adjudicator to the de-metallization centers, respectively the landfills. Importance of the market: Total tonnage of waste to be transported per year: approximately 90,000 tonnes Total tonnage of clinker/ash to be evacuated per year: approximately 35,000 tons Number of road/rail transshipment points: max 10 Number of unloading stations: 1 for lot 1 and 3 to 4 for lot 2 rail transport services for incinerable waste This is a service market which includes all of the transfers to the contracting authority's station for its waste supply and from the same station for the evacuation of bottom ash and ashes. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: COMMUNE DE BAVOIS (JAQUIER POINTET). Summary: Pdaf - Lot 1 - Repair of Af Roads. Description: The Municipality of Bavois, through its PDAF, wishes to carry out lot 1 of the repair work of AF paths, including the repair of the roadway, as well as the execution of excavations for the laying new pipes. The general management of project, as well as civil engineering services are carried out by the Jaquier Pointet SA office. The complete repair of the roadway is planned for roads 9a - 19a - 32 - 33b - 39 - 43 - 44. The work will include: • Stripping work • Earthworks and excavations • Installation of EC collectors • Installation of 8 wolf jaws • Spot repairs to concrete slabs • Installation of bituminous carpet The Municipality of Bavois would like particular attention to be paid to recycling on place of demolition materials for existing concrete slabs, which will be reused (in the whenever possible) in the future road box. Description: In order to optimize the quality of cleaning services on its various sites, EPFL wishes to tender the maintenance cleaning of a certain number of premises and buildings. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: IRBIS CONSULTING SA. Summary: Energy Remediation and Renovation of Eterpeys Buildings in Lausanne - Architect Services. Description: The contract concerns architect services for the energy sanitation project and the renovation of buildings located Chemin des Eterpeys 1-3-5-7 / 10-12-14 / 24-26-28 in Lausanne. Built in 1986, these 3 buildings house 74 apartments, a daycare, shops and two underground garages. The services to be carried out cover the project phases of the work, authorization request, call for tenders and completion of the work (excluding works management) in accordance with SIA regulations. 102 and 112. Works management services will be provided by the Project Owner. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: AXPO GRID AG. Summary: L220 110 Kv Line Freienbach - Siebnen, Cable Pipe Block. Description: 1.1 Introduction AXPO Grid AG operates a supra-regional distribution network in the “Zürichsee Süd” area. By converting the existing Freienbach - Siebnen overhead line (L220) from 50 kV to 110 kV, the conditions will be created in the “Zurichsee Süd” region. to change the voltage. This serves to ensure long-term security of supply of electrical energy throughout northeastern Switzerland. The existing overhead line between the Freienbach and Siebnen substations from the Waldegg in Freienbach and the Wiler Äbnet in Altendorf were buried. Axpo intends to wire the existing 16 or 50 kV overhead line between the M57 to M83 masts with a single strand and between the M83 mast and the M115 mast with two strands. The approximately 8.2 km long The majority of the pipeline section is to be laid underground in open trenches, supplemented by ramming and flushing drilling. All planned measures (cable pipe routes, crossings under bodies of water and modes of transport) are in the planning documents included for submission. The dismantling of the existing overhead line is not the subject of this submission. The work is accompanied by environmental construction supervision (UBB) and soil science construction supervision (BBB). The relevant requirements are taken into account in the submission documents and can be found in detail in the corresponding environmental note for the project. 1.2 Initial situation / project description The advertised services include the following main.... Published Date: 2025-12-15. Closing Date: 2026-01-16. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Description: The area around Rüschlikon train station is to be redesigned in the coming years. On the former SBB site on the lakeside side of the tracks, the “Bahnhof Süd” project is intended to create six new buildings with 37 affordable apartments, small businesses and a local supplier arise. Voters approved the corresponding design plan in November 2017. The developer for the part on the Bahnhofsplatz side (houses I (A) - III (C)) is the municipality. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: STATE OF VALAIS, REAL ESTATE AND HERITAGE SERVICE - INVESTMENTS. Summary: Extension and Renovation of the St-Maurice High School - Cfc 23. Description: The Lycée-Collège de Saint-Maurice welcomes around 1,100 students supervised by around a hundred teachers. With a long educational tradition, this emblematic place plays a key role in the gymnasium training of the canton of Valais, and enjoys a reputation confirmed. The establishment is spread over two distinct sites: * the Lycée-Collège site located in the immediate vicinity of the train station and the old town of Saint-Maurice; * the site of the Sports Zone, adjacent to the town's sports facilities. These two sites are just over 300 meters apart, or about a five-minute walk. The extension and transformation project for the Lycée-Collège provides for the construction, to the northwest of the site, of a new wooden pavilion comprising a basement and four levels. It also includes the renovation of the Boarding School, owned by the Abbey of Saint-Maurice, as well as the transformation of the existing H-shaped building. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: HBD - OFFICE FOR BUILDINGS (AHB). Summary: Bav 57089 Parking Garage Hardau Ii, Partial Repair, General Planning Services (Subject to Credit Approval). Description: Partial repair of Hardau II parking garage, general planning services (subject to credit approval) The Hardau II parking garage was built as part of the overall development between 1976 and 1979. Investigations have shown that the parking floor ceilings are in a damaged condition; Moisture penetration and reinforcement corrosion can be observed. In addition, the parking deck coverings have reached the end of their service life with almost 50 years of use. In some places the building technology needs to be be adjusted or supplemented. The repair work is intended to create an intervention-free period of at least 25 years. Procurement of general planning services (BKP 298.1) with the following required team members / departments: - BKP 291 Architecture/Construction Management - BKP 292 Civil Engineering - BKP 293 Electrical Engineering - BKP 294 HVAC engineering - BKP 295 Sanitary Engineering Details according to the planner choice program BAV 57089 Hardau II parking garage, partial repair, General planning services (subject to credit approval) Partial repair of Hardau II parking garage, general planning services (subject to credit approval) The Hardau II parking garage was built as part of the overall development between 1976 and 1979 created. Description: The contract includes the construction of the A9 construction runway in Pfyn over a length of around 5.5 km north of the future motorway route. This temporary road ensures access to the A9 construction sites, local development and the preservation of cycle route no. 1. The work includes the removal and storage of the topsoil, the earthworks, the construction of the roadway, the drainage, the adaptation of the underground pipes including drinking water to Milieren, the installation of guardrails, the marking and Signaling. To ensure the south-north flow of a bisse during work on the A9 cover construction, a service bridge is being built on the B-1700 cross section. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: REGIONAL TRANSPORT BERN-SOLOTHURN AG (RBS). Summary: New Depot Construction Including Conversion of Bätterkinden Train Station (Bkp 211 Construction Work). Description: The Bern Solothurn RBS regional transport company is planning to build a maintenance and parking facility (depot) in Bätterkinden. This new depot will replace the facilities in Solothurn and Worblaufen in the future. The existing one is located to the east of the planned depot facility Bätterkinden train station. This will also be converted as part of the construction of the depot. Furthermore, the outdoor facilities around the depot will be rebuilt, for example as a storage and scheduling facility. RBS intends to rebuild the train station for the new depot and to procure the construction work for the parking facility. Details can be found in the work contract and its appendices. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: COMPAGNIE DU CHEMIN DE FER MONTREUX OBERLAND BERNOIS SA - INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS. Summary: Mob - Zelgbach Bridge - Bridge Replacement. Description: The services that are the subject of this tender consist of the replacement of the MOB Zelgbach Bridge and the accompanying bicycle and pedestrian passerelle. The existing abutments will be rebuilt to support the new steel bridge. The passerelle will completely replaced by a new support made of I-profile, including abutment. The main work will be carried out in one interruption of the railway line (8 days), namely: dismantling of the existing bridges and abutments, construction of the new, partially prefabricated ones Abutment, installation of the new bridge girders/passerelle. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: DEPARTMENT OF NATIONAL ROAD CONSTRUCTION / SERVICE DE LA CONSTRUCTION DES ROUTES NATIONALES. Summary: Baulos L10075, Sl Baupiste Pfyn-Finges. Description: The contract includes the construction of the A9 construction runway in Pfyn over a length of around 5.5 km north of the future motorway route. This temporary road ensures access to the A9 construction sites, local development and the preservation of cycle route no. 1. The work includes the removal and storage of the topsoil, the earthworks, the construction of the roadway, the drainage, the adaptation of the underground pipes including drinking water to Milieren, the installation of guardrails, the marking and Signaling. To ensure the south-north flow of a bisse during work on the A9 cover construction, a service bridge is being built on the B-1700 cross section. Main CPV: 45233110 Highway construction works. Published Date: 2025-12-12. Closing Date: 2026-01-30. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: FEDERAL ROADS OFFICE FEDRO - WEST ROAD INFRASTRUCTURE DEPARTMENT - THUN BRANCH. Summary: N06.44 Mp-250007 - Neb Ep Spiez - Kandersteg - Project Author Construction - Phase Ek (Id 11614). Description: A maintenance project is planned for the national road section N06.44/48 Spiez - Kandersteg, which has been handed over to the federal government since 2020. In addition to the route, the 23.9 km long route includes, among other things, two tunnels (Spiezwiler and Mitholz) as well as numerous Artistic buildings. Due to the cantonal nature of the route, slow traffic, the environment and noise are important aspects that must be taken into account. PV Bau is in charge of coordinating all departments. The mandate starts with the basic procurement and their analysis. The creation of a global conservation concept (EK) must further be used to check whether the route complies with today's standards and the current state of the art, as well as the procedure and measures for the further course of the project to suggest. This procurement contains the mandate of project author construction for the basic procurement and EK phases. In addition, a VoMa phase will be advertised, which includes the development of a possible VoMa within the project perimeter. The Phase is only triggered if, during the development of the global conservation concept, it turns out that repair of a section or individual object cannot wait until implementation in the conservation project. The project authors BSA, environment/noise and traffic departments are advertised separately. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: REGIONALTRAFFIC BERN-SOLOTHURN AG (RBS). Summary: New Depot Construction Including Conversion of Bätterkinden Train Station (Bkp 211 Construction Work). Description: The Bern Solothurn RBS regional transport company is planning to build a maintenance and parking facility (depot) in Bätterkinden. This new depot will replace the facilities in Solothurn and Worblaufen in the future. The existing one is located to the east of the planned depot facility Bätterkinden train station. This will also be converted as part of the construction of the depot. Furthermore, the outdoor facilities around the depot will be rebuilt, for example as a storage and scheduling facility. RBS intends to rebuild the train station for the new depot and to procure the construction work for the parking facility. Details can be found in the work contract and its appendices. Main CPV: 4,500,000 construction works. Published Date: 2025-12-11. Closing Date: 2026-01-26. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: BLS AG - FINANCE & SCM - STRATEGIC PROCUREMENT. Summary: Project Planning Services for Traction Current. Description: The contact line systems (FL systems) from BLS Netz AG form a central basis for safe and efficient rail operations. Many of these systems have reached the end of their technical lifespan or are no longer up to date of technology. In addition, operational and infrastructural adjustments repeatedly lead to necessary changes to the contact line systems. The planning and implementation of these measures require specialized project planning services that include technical, Comprehensively take operational and legal requirements into account. This tender is intended to attract qualified external partners to provide project planning services in the area of ​​traction current/catenary. The services include the Planning, project planning and support for renewals, adaptations or new construction of contact line systems on the BLS Netz AG route network. The three best-rated providers in the tender will each receive a framework agreement with a fixed term of three years. The BLS reserves the right to extend the contract twice, for one year each. As part of these contracts, specific project orders are awarded on a project-by-project basis using the so-called minitender process, in which offers are submitted from all framework contract partners be collected and evaluated. The aim is to ensure flexible, efficient and high-quality project planning of the contact line systems in order to ensure long-term and safe rail operations on the BLS network. Main CPV: 71300000 Engineering office services. Published Date: 2025-12-10. Closing Date: 2026-02-13. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: BLS AG - FINANCE & SCM - STRATEGIC PROCUREMENT
output.Summary: Project Planning Services for Traction Current
output.Description: The contact line systems (FL systems) from BLS Netz AG form a central basis for safe and efficient rail operations. Many of these systems have reached the end of their technical lifespan or are no longer up to date of technology. In addition, operational and infrastructural adjustments repeatedly lead to necessary changes to the contact line systems. The planning and implementation of these measures require specialized project planning services that include technical, Comprehensively take operational and legal requirements into account. This tender is intended to attract qualified external partners to provide project planning services in the area of ​​traction current/catenary. The services include the Planning, project planning and support for renewals, adaptations or new construction of contact line systems on the BLS Netz AG route network. The three best-rated providers in the tender will each receive a framework agreement with a fixed term of three years. The BLS reserves the right to extend the contract twice, for one year each. As part of these contracts, specific project orders are awarded on a project-by-project basis using the so-called minitender process, in which offers are submitted from all framework contract partners be collected and evaluated. The aim is to ensure flexible, efficient and high-quality project planning of the contact line systems in order to ensure long-term and safe rail operations on the BLS network. Main CPV: 71300000 Engineering office services

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: RHAETIAN RAILWAY AG. Summary: Davos Laret Pilot Road Renewal 2026. Description: On the Cavaduerli - Davos Laret section between km 39.281 - 40.631, a pilot road renewal is planned.<br> The track section exhibits greater track position instability, especially in summer. The gravel is heavily contaminated with fine particles. Due to the expansion of services, this route is heavily used, so the load on the track does not decrease. In order not to worsen the current condition, the section should be rebuilt as soon as possible. The synergies and route closures should be used of the train station project in order not to open another construction site at a later date (approx. in 5-10 years). At the same time, this section of track represents an optimal test field for verifying the results of the RAILplus vehicle/track interaction research project. The plan is to build a complete new track with a renewal of the subsoil, including the installation of a PSS in sections and an AC Rail surface, including the associated drainage system. At the same time, all cable systems will be renewed and expanded. The superstructure is then complete renewed. The system and research findings from the above-mentioned research project are implemented in the superstructure renovation. Sleeper soles, new rail steel, new intermediate layers, etc. are installed. An initial grinding and pre-conditioning are also carried out Skiing.... Published Date: 2025-12-09. Closing Date: 2026-01-23. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

This requires an expansion of the charging infrastructure in the Wankdorf depot in stages is implemented so that the new electric heavy motor vehicles can be charged and used in operation.<br> The subject of this call for tenders concerns the first stage and includes the following main services:<br> - Delivery of the charging infrastructure for eight charging points including the required one Accessories as well as two mobile charging stations and access systems for the parking spaces, suspended from the ceiling (e.g. cable reel, pulley or similar). input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: BASEL UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL. Summary: Replacement Surgical Image Data Management, Surgical Lights & Ceiling Supply Units. Description: The University Hospital of Basel (USB) is planning to replace the operating room image data management system (BDMS) and the operating room lights (OPL) in all operating theaters EAST and WEST and also replace the ceiling supply units (DVE) in the WEST area. The aim of the project is to procure modern, future-oriented and cross-system compatible solutions that ensure high image quality, optimal working conditions and maximum patient safety.<br> A central focus is on the seamless integration of the new image data management into the existing PACS in order to To ensure structured, secure and standardized archiving of all image and video data generated in the operating room. The new operating lights and ceiling supply units should also enable ergonomic, hygienic and workflow-oriented improvements and be technically coordinated with each other be.<br> The hospital attaches particular importance to robust, economically viable and long-term operable solutions that ensure reliable operation, low lifecycle costs and sustainable expandability. This is intended to be future-proof, digitally networked and operationally stable Surgical environment can be created.<br> The tender will be divided into three separate lots to enable the procurement process to be clearly structured and to meet the specific technical requirements of the individual components. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: CANTON OF ST.GALLEN, CIVIL ENGINEERING OFFICE, ROAD AND ARTIFICIAL BUILDINGS. Summary: Kantonsstrasse No. 13, Wattwil: Junction Wilerstrasse - Ebnaterstrasse. Description: The cantonal road no. 13 leads from Buetschwil to Wildhaus. The junction Wilerstrasse Ebnaterstrasse - Poststrasse in the center of Wattwil is to be structurally adapted. In 2022, the political community of Wattwil redesigned Poststrasse and Bahnhofstrasse and made the traffic regime in the junction provisional changed. The lines will be slightly adjusted over a length of 150 m. All edge borders will be repositioned and two central protection islands will be built to ensure safe crossing of the pedestrian routes. A sidewalk crossing will be implemented at the intersection of Poststrasse and Engelgasse. The street drainage is adjusted slightly. Due to the adjustment of the lines in the area of ​​the village bridge, adjustments to the sealing using mastic asphalt are necessary.<br> Main CPV: 45000000 Construction work. Published Date: 2025-12-08. Closing Date: 2026-01-27. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: CANTON OF ST.GALLEN, CIVIL ENGINEERING OFFICE, ROAD AND ARTIFICIAL BUILDINGS. Summary: Kantonsstrasse No. 74, Vilters-Wangs: Elcotherm Walking and Cycling Path to Baltschana Roundabout. Description: The civil engineering department of the Canton of St.Gallen is planning to build a new footpath and cycle path along Cantonstrasse No. 74 (Sarganserstrasse) between the Elcotherm site and the Baltschana roundabout in the municipality of Vilters-Wangs. For the implementation, an engineering office is being sought that has the following: Project phases are taken over: Phase 3 project planning with the sub-phases legal remedies and land acquisition, phase 4 tendering with sub-phase 41 and phase 5 execution with sub-phases 51 to 53. The aim of the project is to correct a identified weak point in the slow transport network and to improve it road safety for pedestrians and cyclists. The new pedestrian and cycle path can be used in both directions, is separated from motorized traffic by a green border and is 3.00 to 3.50 meters wide. In addition, adjustments to the existing road infrastructure, Works pipelines, drainage systems and landscaping measures such as the creation of an avenue of trees are planned. The planning takes into account geological and environmental aspects, especially in the area of ​​the Vilterser Wangser Canal.<br> Main CPV: 71000000 services of architecture, construction and engineering offices and testing centers. Published Date: 2025-12-08. Closing Date: 2026-02-09. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Description: Renovation of the Bäumlihof gymnasium and swimming pool, Basel: The high school was planned from 1972 to 1974 by Vischer Architekten AG, Basel. The facility, designed in the functional style of the 1970s, comprises a total of seven wings, including two swimming pools and six gymnasiums. The four school wings were completely renovated between September 2014 and August 2018. Section T (gym and swimming pool) was put on hold and will be completed in the coming years. The project perimeter of the renovation is limited to the building itself. A change of use is not planned. The conversion will take place in two stages, with the first stage being converted while the second stage is still in operation. After a moving phase and commissioning of the first stage, the second stage will be renovated. With The current advertisement is looking for a company that will carry out gardening work in order to redesign/repair the area after the renovation work. Main CPV: 45233120 Road construction works. Published Date: 2025-12-05. Closing Date: 2026-02-06. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: MUNICIPALITY OF BUBIKON - REAL ESTATE DEPARTMENT (FUHR BUSER PARTNER BAUOEKONOMIE AG). Summary: Bubikon School and Sports Facility: Client Support. Description: In view of the age and condition of the existing buildings of the school and sports facility in Bubikon and the expected increase in the number of students, the municipality launched a selective two-stage study contract for general planning teams in 2024. The focus of the study assignment was on developing a holistic project idea for the designated space requirements of the Bubikon school, taking into account the inventoried Sypcherwise building. The WALDRAP team, Krebs- und Herde, Lüchinger + Meyer Partner, Amstein + Walthert and Weber Energie und Bauphysik won the study contract. The community will vote on the project loan in December 2025, so that project work can start in January 2026. Main CPV: 71541000 Project management in construction. Published Date: 2025-12-05. Closing Date: 2026-01-22. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: MUNICIPALITY OF BUBIKON - REAL ESTATE DEPARTMENT (FUHR BUSER PARTNER BAUOEKONOMIE AG)
output.Summary: Bubikon School and Sports Facility: Client Support
output.Description: In view of the age and condition of the existing buildings of the school and sports facility in Bubikon and the expected increase in the number of students, the municipality launched a selective two-stage study contract for general planning teams in 2024. The focus of the study assignment was on developing a holistic project idea for the designated space requirements of the Bubikon school, taking into account the inventoried Sypcherwise building. The WALDRAP team, Krebs- und Herde, Lüchinger + Meyer Partner, Amstein + Walthert and Weber Energie und Bauphysik won the study contract. The community will vote on the project loan in December 2025, so that project work can start in January 2026. Main CPV: 71541000 Project management in construction

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: MUNICIPALITY OF KILCHBERG (FUHR BUSER PARTNER BAUOEKONOMIE AG). Summary: Workshop and Fire Depot Kilchberg (Zh) - Submission of Building Services Planning. Description: A new fire department building is to be built for the Kilchberg-Rueschlikon safety association. The existing location is in the middle of a residential area on Alte Landstrasse in Kilchberg and no longer meets today's requirements. Also located on the same property the workshop of the municipality of Kilchberg. In order to free up the area for more suitable uses and to better utilize synergies between both companies, a new joint building is to be built on the Im Tal area. The competition entry armadillo by Allemann Bauer Eigenmann Architects is intended for this purpose and Bueeler Fischli civil engineers (formerly Aerni+Aerni engineers). To supplement the planning team, this tender will be used to procure a planning office for planning building technology (heating, cooling, ventilation, plumbing, building automation and specialist coordination).<br> Main CPV: 71300000 Engineering consultancy services. Published Date: 2025-12-04. Closing Date: 2026-01-21. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: HORW MUNICIPAL ADMINISTRATION. Summary: Pile Foundations. Description: The planned new building of the Allmend primary school aims to create a future-proof, sustainable and educationally functional infrastructure for primary levels 1 to 6. The four-story building will be built using conventional timber construction on the school site and will replace the existing outdoor sports facility ("Red Square").<br> In particular, two groundwater levels that must be separated from each other must be taken into account. The subsoil requires a pile foundation (concrete displacement bored piles), also for factory pipes and inspection shafts (wooden posts).<br> With regard to flood protection, the new building meets the requirements of HQ300 - building technology is placed on the ground floor and top floor (no basement) to avoid damage from flood events. The supporting structure of the building is based on a solid wood skeleton made of Fi/Ta. This is complemented by three solid service cores made of reinforced concrete. The spiral staircases between the service cores are also made of reinforced concrete. The facade consists of prefabricated wooden post external elements. The building will comply with SNBS 2.1 Building construction certified (goal is gold certification). The energy is supplied via a connection to the local SeeEnergy district heating network (winter heat, summer cooling water). All areas are covered with underfloor heating. Description: According to Article 3 of the Federal Act on Climate Protection Goals, Innovation and Strengthening Energy Security (KlG; SR 814.310), human-caused greenhouse gas emissions in Switzerland should be zero by 2050 (Net zero target). This goal also applies to Swiss air traffic. In the 2024 report on CO2-neutral flying by 2050, the Federal Council shows the necessary measures for this. In addition to improved aircraft technology and operational Improvements, the use of sustainable aviation fuels (SAF) as so-called drop-in fuels represents the most important technical measure for reducing fossil CO2 emissions in aviation. Main CPV: 90700000 Environmental protection services. Published Date: 2025-12-03. Closing Date: 2026-02-02. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Description: As part of the expansion of the district heating network, a new main line will be built on Wermatswilerstrasse between Pfaffikerstrasse and Wagerenstrasse. At the same time, the water pipes from 1968-1974 will be replaced or renovated and new above-ground hydrants will be installed. The work is done predominantly in a combination ditch.<br> In addition, the EW route will be expanded, for which several existing distribution cabins (VK) and cable ducts will be dismantled, enlarged or newly created.<br> The Weidli stop will be converted to accommodate disabled people (raised stop edge), and the old one, which is no longer used Waiting hall is canceled.<br> In addition, district heating is also to be expanded in Weidstrasse.<br> Civil engineering work on Wermatswiler-/Weidstrasse, Uster<br> As part of the expansion of the district heating network, a new main line will be built on Wermatswilerstrasse between Pfaffikerstrasse and Wagerenstrasse. Summary: Bkp 242 Heating Systems / 246 Refrigeration System | Vertical Extension of Gymnasiums Tbs5, Weinfelden. Description: Subject of the Contract: As part of the project, the existing gymnasium will be extended by adding two additional floors for use as a secondary school. The extension will be constructed using timber element construction. The new/extended staircases will be built as double-shell structures in exposed concrete. The two-story extension will include 12 classrooms (one of which will be equipped as a learning space), 7 group rooms, and two staff rooms with a terrace. At the heart of the school, a single-story atrium (open to the outside climate) is designed. Special Conditions: The renovation will take place predominantly during ongoing operations. A complete closure of the gymnasium is only planned for the duration of the timber construction work for the extension Heating: The existing woodchip heating system of the school has sufficient capacity to cover the extension as well. Heat distribution will be provided via underfloor heating. Through a changeover switch in the technical center, slight cooling can also be achieved via the underfloor heating. A heating/cooling coil in the ventilation unit allows the supply air to be heated in winter and slightly cooled in summer. The extension will include a substation on the 2nd floor, which will be connected to the main line in the technical center located in the basement of the gymnasium, requiring minor adjustment work. The extension will be constructed using timber element construction. The new/extended staircases will be built as double-shell structures in exposed concrete. The two-story extension will include 12 classrooms (one of which will be equipped as a learning space), 7 group rooms, and two staff rooms with a terrace. At the heart of the school, a single-story atrium (open to the outside climate) is designed. Special Conditions: The renovation will take place predominantly during ongoing operations. A complete closure of the gymnasium is only planned for the duration of the timber construction work for the extension Ventilation Systems: The ventilation unit will be installed in the technical center on the 2nd floor, ensuring short duct runs for outdoor air intake and exhaust air discharge. A combined ventilation system is planned. Conditioned air will be supplied at two points per floor in the main circulation areas near floor level. Extract air will be captured near the ceiling. Classrooms will be ventilated using a so-called “lung ventilation” concept: the conditioned supply air is introduced into the circulation zone, which serves as the lung. Air exchange to classrooms and group rooms will occur via transfer fans. Only the WC rooms and the cleaning room will be continuously supplied and extracted through conventional ventilation.... input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: CONSTRUCTION AND TRANSPORT DEPARTMENT OF THE CANTON OF BASEL-STADT, CANTONAL DEPARTMENT FOR PUBLIC PROCUREMENT (KFÖB). Summary: Mp 2647 Renovation Margarethental Bridge, Builder. Description: The TBA is repairing the Margarethental Bridge. There are concrete repairs to the bridge vault, the supports and the bridge slab. The existing covering and sealing are demolished, re-sealed and provided with a new covering. The Granite stones are temporarily demolished for the work on the bridge and then placed back on the bridge after the repair work. The railing is demolished and replaced with a new railing. The railing work including anchoring is not Part of the tender. Various lines (gas, water, electrical) from the IWB run in the bridge structure. There are also cables on the side. The lines will all be dismantled and some will be replaced. This requires construction pits before and after the bridge be created in order to reconnect and lay the factory lines. After refilling, the rolled covering including the foundation is replaced in the area. Main CPV: 4,500,000 construction works. Published Date: 2025-12-02. Closing Date: 2026-01-13. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: REGIONAL TRAFFIC BERN-SOLOTHURN RBS. Summary: New Rbs Depot Building Including Conversion of Bätterkinden Train Station (Bkp213/214 Steel and Timber Construction Work). Description: The Bern Solothurn RBS regional transport company is planning to build a maintenance and parking facility (depot) in Bätterkinden. This new depot will replace the facilities in Solothurn and Worblaufen in the future. The existing one is located to the east of the planned depot facility Bätterkinden train station. This will also be converted as part of the construction of the depot. Furthermore, the outdoor facilities around the depot will be rebuilt, for example as a storage and scheduling facility. RBS intends to use steel and steel for the new depot Procure timber construction work. The RBS intends to procure the assembly work for steel and timber construction for the depot building in a joint lot. These include, among other things, steel-wood composite elements that require close cooperation between steel and and wood builders require in work and assembly planning, transport, storage and installation. Main CPV: 45223210 Construction work for steel structures. Published Date: 2025-12-02. Closing Date: 2026-03-16. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed
